reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have included some pictures of Sealodge Cond B3. Upon arriving the one thing I did notice was a musty smell. It wasn't anything bad and I did notice that smell in a few places that we were shopping at. I figured it was a combination of the humidity and all of the rain that they get. The condo has everything that you need. They even included an ice chest and sand and beach chairs. They have a washer and dryer, all the cooking utensils that you need, except tongs as we noticed when we barbequed one evening. The views are exceptional, especially from the bedroom. There is a bench outdoors where you find many couples just waiting for the sunset. I would stay there again. The price is right and as I mentioned there's everything that you need.
reviews.title: Wonderful views of the ocean

likes.disliked: — Pool closed too early. It closed at 7:00 pm so we never used it.

reviews.text: We stayed at D-4 in Sealodge. A beautiful condo. What a great view. Air conditioned one bedroom unit with a view of the ocean from all the windows. Nearby ziplining was terrific as was Kayaking the Hanalei river. The condo had everything we needed for an incredibly comfortable stay. We'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: What a terrific place!!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sealodge for two nights this past May for a wedding. And I am certainly glad we only had to stay here for two nights and not any more.
reviews.title: Old and dirty, G5 needs some renovation!

reviews.text: I rented G5 through the Hestera website and the service was fantastic. My emails or phone calls were all returned promptly with professional service. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor I knew that the rooms really varied and I had hoped I had made a good decision. I was partly wrong, we can all be the "cup is half full" people, right?
reviews.title: What a View!

likes.liked: — The view and the condition of the unit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering the condo I was pleased, it was definitely smaller than the condo we had stayed in previously but it was nice. And the view, that is to die for, wonderful. There is a small living room and an even smaller eat in kitchen, but this is vacation, who cooks? It was wonderful having a washer and dryer right in the condo with us, and you didn't have to pay for it!! It seemed well stocked with items to use on the beach although we didn't get a chance to use any of them. There is a bedroom with a bathroom off of the kitchen with an accordion type door. (My in-laws used this bedroom so I can't comment on it.) Then there is a set of stairs up to the loft where there are two twin beds and another bathroom. (This is where my husband and I stayed.)
reviews.title: Sealodge C5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it comes to a condo complex, it often varies from unit to unit. Sealodge G2 may not boast to be the best unit in the complex, but it's definitely one the better maintained units with a gorgeous ocean view. I really enjoyed sitting by the french doors in the morning or the evening to gaze out at the ocean.
reviews.title: Sealodge G2 - A great unit!
Sealodge B-12, "Not a Breathtaking Experience!", Princeville Kauai
reviews.text: The Sealodge, B-12, ----, is not a breathtaking experience! It is a simple vacation condo among other vacation condos in Princeville. Please be very cautious, as the pictures on the website are not true. When arriving the condo had musty/moldy smell, although it was semi-clean there was house cleaning done prior to settling in. There is not ocean view nor is there a beach close, the grounds are clean and there is a simple pool and bbq area. This would be fine for an individual or couple who do not seek lavish amenities. It is fairly priced (if you like to pay for insects.)
As for the management of the property, that is less than desirable. We had many visitors including lizards/geckos, bugs and the best- A CENTIPEDE IN OUR BED!
reviews.title: Sealodge F8 - Great place to stay and visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to draw the line here and went and checked into another hotel. Management refused to refund our money for the nights we could not stay there and accused us leaving condo with broken TV, which was not true.
reviews.title: Wow! What a view!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be assured this is a not a breathtaking experience, but rather an insect ridden condo! The management even wanted to spray the condo while we were staying there, no disclosure of this or the insects!
reviews.title: paradise found !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed 3 nights. Loved it. Condo F9 was well equipped with all kitchen needs and beach stuff, plus it is newly renovated and extra clean.. Has spectacular views of the ocean and the mountains. Very private on 3rd floor no condos next door. Location is excellent...minutes to snorkeling, kayaking, Na Pali hiking. Also grocery store and restaurants are less than a mile from condo.
reviews.title: Great condo - location and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Kauai. We booked condo E10 purely from photos we saw online. We have never booked a condo online before so we truly did not know what to expect. We arrived after dark our first night so finding the property was tad difficult but not horrid. We walked in to a very stuffy condo, quickly opened the windows and then were blown way but the incredible view that awaited us from every window in the place. Even in the dark we knew we had found a slice of heaven on earth. Everywhere we looked were beautiful ocean vistas. The stuffiness in the condo disappeared once the windows were opened and the ocean breeze blew in. There was no need for air conditioning at all.
reviews.title: Sealodge E10.... heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had everything we needed in the condo. The bed was comfortable, there were plenty of pillows, t he furniture was comfy and nice, we had a TV, movies, cd player and cds to choose from, even board games if needed, plus chairs/umbrellas for the beach, all the cooking utensil you could possibly need, a washer and dryer, you name it, it was there.
reviews.title: Sealodge is a great choice!

likes.liked: — Having more space and amenities than a hotel room--like laundry and a kitchen
likes.disliked: — The towels provided by the condo were small and cheap-feeling

reviews.text: Our only complaints were the bathroom towels were worse than what you find at a Motel 6! And the bathroom had no air circulation. It was humid to stand in the bathroom after your shower. Since it was just my husband and I staying, we just got dressed in the bedroom area, but if you had more than 2 staying in the condo (which is possible because the couch pulls out) the bathroom would become a real issue.
reviews.title: Great Condo

reviews.text: The owners suggested you wash towels often (and that you bring your own beach towels) so I did a load every night. Not a problem and actually I count this a plus for the condo. We would enjoy our views from our deck each night while laundry was going.
reviews.title: Sealodge a great stay if you like it simple.

likes.disliked: — occasional noise from adjoining units due to open windows (no a/c)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small L shaped studio which they billed as a one bedroom. Our third person had to stay elsewhere. Also the door to the toilet is a swinging saloon style so the privacy there is limited. They called it for honeymooners and that may be because only the bed and sofa were comfortable. The dining chairs were too high for the table, couldn't sit there. Large furniture was for their stuff and the bench seat was a joke. The view was beautiful but the windows and balcony were so dirty as to make us want to get out of there. It is too bad for VRBO that they aren't made to disclose all the facts. We would not reccommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Unit A-2 Not what they said, it is a studio not a one bedroom

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from a wonderful five day stay at SeaLodge unit J-7. While the complex is older, the grounds and unit we stayed in were clean and very well maintained. We dealt directly with the owner (Carol), and had a positive interaction at every step.
reviews.title: Great stay at SeaLodge J-7

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The footprint of the unit is small, however, the layout is well configured and gave us all of the room we needed. We have children (boys 9 and 5), and there was enough to do - a TV, DVD player, cable, and wireless internet connection - to keep them occupied on the rare occasions when we were inside (at night and early morning). The unit also had three boogie boards for us to use, which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Sealodge unit D-8 is perfect!

likes.liked: — The scenery, decor and cleanliness of the place.
likes.disliked: — The bath towels could be a little better quality, but now bad.

reviews.text: The view from the window of this second story unit was spectacular. The complex is located on a cliff about 100 feet above the largest reef in Hawaii, off of Anini Beach. The whales and dolphins were out in full force, and we could have spent all day looking out at the sealife in the waves.
reviews.title: Know what you are getting; UNIT B10
I cant believe how much I loved our unit!
reviews.text: SeaLodge is located in Princeville, a planned community on the north shore. There is not much to do at night in the area, which was just fine with us, since our children were ready to crash after dinner. We visited in February, the rainy season in that area. The rain never lasted very long when it came, and we just made plans to travel to sunnier parts of the island for beach and other outdoor activities.
